page.title: 06Church in Carshalton today.
page.content: All Saints Parish Church is the very old Anglican church adjacent to the ponds.In Carshalton there are also two Roman Catholic churches (one by the station and one in Fir Tree Grove);one Methodist church in Ruskin Road; two Baptist churches and the West St. Chapel for open brethren. The Parish Church has very close links with the church school and has about lOO communicants at each Sunday Mass.There is a daily Eucharist. In l985 the large Willis organ, originally built in l895 was rebuilt thanks to a large bequest of money. The 9 acres of churchyard are being landscaped and renovated by workers from the Manpower Servies Commission.This project is expected to cost Â£l5O,OOO. New trees are being planted and flora noted. The churches work together and on Good Friday have a joint march of witness.
